intro: Petrophile cunninghamii var. major, commonly known as the tall rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Its flowers are usually pink or red, arranged in dense spikes, and it produces small, woody fruits. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
